titlStmt.titl: Draft genome sequences of eight Vibrio sp. clinical isolates from across the United States that forms a basal sister clade to Vibrio cholerae

citation.biblCit: Liang, Kevin; Islam, Mohammad Tarequl; Hussain, Nora; Winkjer, Nathan S; Rowe, Lori A; Im, Monica; Boucher, Yan; Tarr, Cheryl L, 2018, "Draft genome sequences of eight Vibrio sp. clinical isolates from across the United States that forms a basal sister clade to Vibrio cholerae", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/IWNRRI, UAL Dataverse, V1

titlStmt.titl: Draft genome sequences of eight Vibrio sp. clinical isolates from across the United States that forms a basal sister clade to Vibrio cholerae

stdyInfo.abstract: We sequenced the genomes of eight isolates from various regions of the United States that show high sequence similarity to Vibrio sp. 2521-89, a recently reported genome(1). These isolates form a monophyletic cluster clearly related but distinct from V. cholerae, representing a highly divergent basal lineage or a potential novel species.

citation.biblCit: Draft genome sequences of eight Vibrio sp. clinical isolates from across the United States that forms a basal sister clade to Vibrio cholerae. Liang K et al 2018. MRA submitted.

otherMat.txt: Average Nucleotide Identity (ANI) and in-silico DNA-DNA Hybridization (isDDH) for all pairwise comparisons between representative Vibrio cholerae strains and the eight isolates.
1000 bootstrap maximum likelihood tree with the eight isolates and representative Vibrio cholerae strains
100 bootstrap tree. Vibrio sp ML tree created with RaxML. Includes representatives Vibrio cholerae strains and the eight additional isolates
